page.title: 03 FARMING - WYESHAM
page.content: We went to see{Mr. Roberts}on the l7th May 1985. He told us that the Dutch Barn was about 100 years old and that the cross beams came from a ship. Mr. Roberts took us to see the milking parlour. He said that the milking parlour was ten years old and the vat held 350 gallons. LIST OF QUESTIONS How many cows have you? 100 How many fields have you? 10 How many{acres} in a field? lO approx. How many cows in each acre? l How many animals become ill each year? 5 or 6 a year. How much would a good cow{cost?}It would cost Â£400. How have machines changed in your time in farming? They have become bigger. What{qualities}are required to be a good farmer? Knowledge of animal welfare, planning and perseverance.
